This is a game that has been praised by the majority, and I for the life of me can not see why. The skyrail mechanic is interesting and has potential, but its usage within such linear level design turns it into a glorified QTE. Perhaps my biggest issue with the game is how much of it you spend doing nothing- it takes way too long before you arrive at any actual gameplay, and even those parts are more infrequent then they really should be. The combat is made somewhat interesting with the "vigors" powers, but for the most part, the gunplay is generic and monotonous. If the story interests you, perhaps you could save time and money by watching the cutscenes on youtube.

This game is awesome, it is unlike any FPS i have ever played. As a guy that enjoys the "srory mode" and fucus less attention on multi player aspects of games, Bioshock Infinite was a must buy for me. The rich and captivating story fully connects you with the characters in way that few RPGs are even able to do. If you enjoy smashing down bad guys with magic and awesome weapons in an artistic world, or love great stories and well created characters, than i highly reccomend this game for you.
Bioshock Infinite has great story, graphics and gameplay. Must Buy.

Основная часть игры сочетает в себе отличный геймплей, историю, саундтрек, графику, словом, все на высоте. Я, как небольшой любитель шутеров, скажу - это того стоило. Может, геймплей чуть уступает первому Bioshock, зато все остальное поднялось на уровень выше предыдущих частей. Лично мой любимый шутер из множества. Игра раскрывает политические, религиозные, философские и фантастические темы в новом свете. Все, от начала до конца, определенно стоит внимания. 9,5/10

Bioshock Infinite - это один из лучших шутеров из всех, что можно себе представить. Для любого геймера (пускай даже не для любителя шутеров) говорю - это того стоит. Для головоломов найдется сюжет, для казуалов скажу - тут вы не получите экран с надписью Game Over (ни считая финальной битвы), для хардкорщиков есть режим 1999 (финальные главы попахивают Dark Souls). Но DLC - жуткий бред. Неудивительно, что оно провалилось в продажах. Оно не плохое, но пора привыкнуть к повторениям - идеи иссякли.

this game is very well done and really is worth the money. by the way if you come across a missing hud glitch? what you do is that you go to  control panel. then go to intel graphic ands media then  go to 3d, change the vertex processing(application settings) to ( enable software processing). but make sure to get the burial at sea dlc but other than that is a game that is worth playing .

Really fun game, and even if you have a computer not really meant for gaming, It'll still run perfectly. I have Windows 8 slightly-crappy laptop, and I didn't expect it to run well, considering how good it looks- like I might have had to turn the graphics down, or the usual 'turn off V-sync' but I didn't even have to do that much and it still works like a charm. ;D As for gameplay- If one is slightly crap at First-Person-Shooters (like me :c )  you still get the melee weapon and the 'vigor' powers, some of which runs on sort of- 'whatever is in that close area you aimed for- we'll attack' system.. Especially if it's on sale, I highly recommend it, even if you're not really one for the genre...?

Pros: This game on high settings is just simply beautiful to look at, from the floating city, to the water effects, to the partical engine, and physics, zipping along the skylines. Just simply beautiful. The gameplay is a slight step back from BioShock 2 in terms of difficulty and being engaging, but i think that is because of the change of scenery. Only having access to two weapons at a time limits the kind of strategy you get from having all those weapons to choose from and the different ammo you can use. Also the "vigors" aka plasmids they give you for most of the game will only be using two maybe three tops all game. These two things can be sort of dismissed because the story line is very good *as always with bioshock series* and lends to itself through out the game and only throws more twists and turns at you the further you go. The "heavy hitters" are pretty awesome and come at you in unique ways making you switch your strategy up signifigantly. 

Cons: Here we go, I am going to be pretty hard on this game since I was in love with the other two. For starters you absolutely need a high end PC for this game, even with high end PC's you will get this thing where Elizibeth will stutter, go choppy and then just bug the hell out. It happened to me and i have a bit over recommender specs and even playing on the lowest setting where my computer could handle it my FPS would drop to under 10 way too much. This is unnaceptable and needs to be looked at. Why is is that aside from Bioshock 1 you have to have some huge issue with all your games that either make them unplayable or totally annoying. Your fans love you and love your games, stop shitting on them with huge PC issues every single time you release the game. Its not good for your sales. In my opinion the game is kind of short 15-18 hours for a single play through and that is searching everywhere, and getting ever single possible thing you can find including all the backtracking and extras, and the occasional staring off into the beautiful word for a few minutes every once and a while. 

Overall: just buy this game, it has a great story line, beautiful graphics, about 18 hours a gameplay in a single runthrough, the problems with the game dont really come close to outweighing the pros. WARNING IF YOU HAVE A LOW END PC DONT BOTHER BUYING THIS GAME YOU WILL LITERALLY WASTE YOUR MONEY>>>>> SERIOUSLY DONT BOTHER. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.            8/10.

I have been a long time player of the Bioshock series and to be honest I absolutely love Infinite! Granted if you followed the development notes Irrational put out during the production you would see that quite a few things are missing but I simply consider that to be the classic issue of developing a game on a timeline. The game is a visual feast and the tonics and gunplay is absolutely a pleasure to use. The combat is fluid and the tonic combinations are a thrill to discover and use in combat. Of course you add in the season pass with the Burial at Sea DLC's and that is a whole new can of worms! For the players of the previous Bioshocks you finally get to see the old Rapture before the fall and get to experience the night of the fall! All in all I absolutely loved them and hope many gamers add this gem to their collection.

One of the best games I have ever played. The story draws you in much like the Dead Island trailer. The difference is that this story comes in a form of a game that you get to play. The mind twisting art direction, beautiful visuals and amazing music is what makes Bioshock Infinite a true work of art.
You can flush a toilet 10/10

Some people would that if you haven't played Bioshock Infinite, you're a fool and don't know because it's one of the best AAA games since <insert previous AAA game title here>. Therefore, you should purchase it IMMEDIATELY if not sooner. 

Others would argue that there are better games to spend your money on. Ones which rhyme with "A Bassin's Steed" or a very realistic hat simulator. 

I contend that if ya ain't bought it, don't. Why? Because, if you don't know what you're missing, how can you "miss it"? 

Hold out until the Summer Sale when it'll probably cheaper. If you REALLY want to save money, hold off until the Winter Sale when they'll probably release the "Game of the year b/c we like long pretentious titles edition" edition.

If you really wanna save yourself some money, here's how it ends:

Comstock was Booker in an alternate reality where he didn’t get baptized. 
Comstock took Booker’s daughter, Anna (Elizabeth). 
Booker went on a repeating and endless cycle of trying to get Ana (Elizabeth) back. 
At the end, Booker let himself be killed before he turned into Comstock which ended the loop and the Comstock timeline. 

5 out of 5 stars - Would buy from again.

스토리가 탄탄한 좋은 작품입니다. 초능력이 워낙 많아서 다 제대로 써먹기도 힘들긴 하지만 그래도 골라가며 쓰는 재미도 있습니다.

This may very well be one of the best games I've ever played, and that praise doesn't come easily. The atmosphere and mood of the game are perfectly executed and it's a very immersive experience. I might try with my Oculus Rift sometime.

The gameplay is nice balance of fast paced, and an opportunity to catch your breath between fights and intense moments.

It is certainly a deviation from the traditional Bioshock, which I know has annoyed some of the fans. I liked the deviation though. The horror aspect never really appealed to me, so leaving most of it behind was a welcome change.

Lastly though. The plot. The execution was stunning, and I found myself lost in the details, stopping at every turn to learn just a little more about the world I was running around in, and the history. I found that you're left with a lot of questions, but it's enough to keep you thinking.

This game is as good as the rave reviews, and unless you don't like FPS games, there is no reason for you to miss this one. Play it!
Gran juego!! emocionante de principio a fin!! todo lo k esperaba de este juego resulto verdad!! 100% recomendado!! lastima k se acabo rapido :(, a por los DLC xD
Graphics on max settings is visually appealing.  Pretty linear play style.
a fun shooter with a great story of trust, twists and good old bloodly and brutal kills

This is a masterpiece because it's more than just a game, it's also social commentary that spans patriotism, corporate vs labor, and religious fanaticism.  It's great story telling with a twist around every corner.  If BF or CoD could be compared to Rambo movies, this is Citizen Kane.

A lot of people were skeptical about BioShock Infinite , mostly because it's not in the classic underwater city of Rapture but in Columbia, a flying city above the skys. But don't worry, this game delivers. 

The graphics, oh, don't even get me started. They are gorgeous. The lighting effects make the experience even more better. Every step you take is marvelous. Also, the voice acting is very good.
Troy Baker, the voice of Joel from the Last of Us and Harvey Dent from Arkham City, does an incredible job as Booker DeWitt. I really think he is one of the best video game voice actors out there. And I'm not even kidding. Go onto IMDb, look up Troy Baker, and you'll be shocked on how many great games he has voice acted in.

Now the story. Booker DeWitt, who must retrieve a mysterious girl from the city of Columbia, to wipe away his debt, keeps you engaged nearly the entire time. Now notice NEARLY. I think that the middle of the game slows down a little bit story-wise and just becomes a few fetch quests like, go here and get this, oh wait, it's not there, it's actually over here, etc. But once you get to that twist man, oh, be ready. It.Is.Shocking.

The gameplay has changed actually quite a bit from the first two BioShock games. You do have plasmids, but they are renamed to vigors. They have similar effects to the plasmids in the first game. The gunplay is smooth and fun, with a nice new feature called the grappling hook, where you can claw enemies in the face or ride ziplines. Those are lots of fun. 

Infinte is a great game. It's a new, original, and fresh FPS that we don't get a lot nowadays. 

Traditional Rating - 9.75/10
Personal Rating - A must-buy

This review will be written / edited as I progress through the game. This way I can touch on all the bases, with nothing being left out. In any case, the very first thing I noticed was the lack of variation in the character models. When I reached the city I noticed there were plenty of NPCs. Out of all the NPCs, there were ~ 6 variants. Meaning, 6 identical sets of clothing and faces. Identical twins everywhere!!! Every cluster of NPCs magically start their conversation when the player is in very close proximity. Monotony anyone?

Also, you start out in a row boat, with no reason, no lore, no anything...  Hopefully as I progress, my opinion will change. Thus far, the immersion factor is very low.

"Bioshock Infinite" es complejo, contradictorio... artístico, al fin y al cabo. Es también, y a malas, hijo de su tiempo, ya que las mecánicas de los shooters actuales mandan en la jugabilidad y dicha herencia no le sienta demasiado bien. Sí, el ritmo es frenético, las peleas muy dinámicas y las armas / vigorizadores son medianamte variados, pero eso no salva el tremendo contraste que resulta al comparar esta entrega con sus predecesoras (y en el que, a mi parecer, "Infinite" sale perdiendo). En "Burial at Sea Ep.1" estos aspectos se ven alterados, volviendo al ritmo y dificultades de Rapture, mientras que en "Burial at Sea Ep.2" se cambia completamente de ritmo y recursos  para centrarse en el sigilo (con una excusa narrativa muy adecuada). 

Hasta aquí ha podido parecer que el juego no me ha convencido, pero nada más lejos de la realidad. Su ambiente, su trama, sus personajes y, sobre todo, Elizabeth, me han atrapado.

Si algo nos quieren contar "Bioshock Infinite" y "Burial at Sea" es la historia de Elizabeth, no la de Booker/la nuestra. Booker/nosotros tan sólo la liberamos de su jaula, la acompañamos y la vemos cambiar para luego dejarnos ir. En cierto punto nos ponemos en su pellejo, pero la voz de Booker/nuestra voz sigue diciéndole qué hacer. Somos poco más que vehículos para su viaje. Uno que merece la pena hacer.
